p.em: “Power is the soul made manifest — and the metal that binds it.”

description.p: The Invested are mortals who manipulate the invisible threads of spirit through metal. By burning metals, storing essence, or forging soul-spikes, they command reality through the mysterious power of Investiture. Whether noble scion or haunted killer, the Invested bridges the gap between mortal and divine through raw spiritual will.

ul.li: Hit Dice: 1d8 per Invested level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per Invested level after 1st
Armor: Light armor
Weapons: Simple weapons
Tools: Smith’s tools
Saving Throws: Constitution, Wisdom
Skills: Choose two from Arcana, Insight, Investigation, Medicine, Perception, or Survival.

description.p: Constitution, Wisdom
At the heart of your abilities lies a pool of Metal Dice — representations of the metals you channel and the spirit that fuels them.
Using Metal Dice. When a class or subclass feature calls for a Metal Die, roll one and apply the result as damage, healing, or power level as described.
Recharging. You regain all expended Metal Dice when you finish a long rest. At 18th level (Sublime Flow), you regain half your expended Metal Dice when you finish a short rest.
Augmentation. Once per turn, you can add a Metal Die to a damage roll, ability check, or saving throw.
Allomantic Metals: Iron (Pull), Steel (Push), Pewter (Strength), Tin (Senses), Brass (Soothe), Zinc (Riot), Bronze (Seek), Copper (Hide), Gold (Heal), Electrum (Future Glimpse)
Feruchemical Attributes: Strength, Health, Speed, Perception, Stamina, Weight
Hemalurgic Spikes: Bestial, Arcane, Resilient, Divine, Mental

sheet.description: A mortal who channels spiritual power through metal, choosing a Path of Allomancy, Feruchemy, or Hemalurgy.

description.p: You awaken your soul’s link to the Metallic Arts and choose a Path: Allomancy, Feruchemy, or Hemalurgy. Your choice grants you features at 1st level and again at 3rd, 5th, 7th, 9th, 13th, and 14th levels.

Your mastery of metal also grants you a pool of Metal Dice, which fuel many of your abilities. At 1st level, you have two Metal Dice, which are d6s. You expend Metal Dice to power class and subclass features.
When you finish a long rest, you regain all expended Metal Dice. Starting at 18th level (Sublime Flow), you also regain half of your expended Metal Dice when you finish a short rest.
Augmentation. Once per turn, when you make a damage roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can roll one of your Metal Dice and add the result to the roll.

Your soul resonates with nearby metal. You can detect the presence of metal within 30 feet of you, even if it is behind total cover, though not its precise shape. You also sense the presence of Invested or magical creatures or objects within this range, though not their exact identity.
You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks to locate hidden metals, metallic mechanisms, or constructs.

You learn to streamline your metalworking of the soul. Once per short or long rest, you can use one minor subclass ability that normally takes an action as a bonus action instead. (Your DM determines which features of your chosen Path count as “minor” for this purpose, but generally shorter-duration, single-target, or utility effects qualify.)
Your reserves deepen. At 6th level, your pool of Metal Dice increases to 3 dice, and their size becomes d8. This matches the Metal Dice table in the class description.
Your soul flows more readily through your metal reserves. When you roll initiative, you regain 1 expended Metal Die.
You can flare metals with remarkable speed. Once on each of your turns, you can use a subclass ability that normally requires an action as a bonus action instead.

You can split your focus between multiple streams of power. On your turn, you can use two different metal-based abilities, as long as they come from different sources (such as different metals or attributes) and obey the normal action economy. For example, you might burn Steel and Pewter in the same turn, or Tap Speed and Strength at once.

You have studied the Metallic Arts beyond the bounds of your own discipline. Choose one feature from another Path of the Invested (Allomancer, Feruchemist, or Hemalurgist) that is gained at 1st, 3rd, 5th, 7th, 9th, or 13th level in that Path. You gain that feature, using your Invested level in place of that Path’s level when needed.
You count as a member of that Path solely for the purpose of using this feature.
Your spirit and metals cycle in a constant rhythm. When you finish a short rest, you regain Metal Dice equal to half the number you have expended (rounded down).
For a brief time, your body radiates pure Investiture and you stand on the edge of divinity. As an action, you can enter an ascendant state that lasts for 1 minute. For the duration:

ul.li: You treat your Metal Dice as unlimited; you can expend them without tracking uses.
You have advantage on all saving throws.
You have resistance to all damage types.
Your weapon attacks and offensive abilities deal radiant or necrotic damage (your choice) instead of their normal type.

description.p: Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

p.em: “I am the storm that bends iron and wills men.”

description.p: Allomancers consume and “burn” trace metals within their bodies to unleash bursts of spiritual power. Iron and Steel push and pull, Pewter hardens flesh, and subtle metals twist emotions and obscure detection. An Allomancer fights as a living engine of flaring metal and will.
You can burn specific metals by expending a Metal Die to produce one of the following effects. Unless otherwise noted, each effect lasts until the start of your next turn.

tr.td: Pull. As an action, choose a metallic object or a creature wearing/carrying metal within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier) or be pulled up to 10 feet toward you, plus 5 feet for each Metal Die expended.

Push. As an action, choose an object or creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be shoved 10 feet away from you, plus 5 feet per Metal Die spent. Alternatively, you can propel yourself, increasing your jump distance and ignoring difficult terrain until the end of your turn.
You gain a +2 bonus to Strength checks, and you gain temporary hit points equal to the result of your Metal Die + your Constitution modifier. These benefits last for 1 minute.
For 1 minute, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks, and you can see in dim light as if it were bright light.

As an action, you soothe a creature’s emotions (as the calm emotions spell) within 30 feet. The target must make a Charisma saving throw against your Invested save DC (8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier).

As an action, you incite a creature within 30 feet to hostility. On a failed Wisdom saving throw, the target must use its reaction (if available) to make one melee attack against a creature of your choice.
You sense Invested or magical effects within 30 feet of you until the end of your next turn, learning their general direction and school or nature of power, if any.
For 1 minute, you and creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you are veiled from divination and detection effects, as if affected by nondetection.
You regain hit points equal to the result of your Metal Die + your Wisdom modifier.
The next time you make an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw within 1 minute, roll 2d20 and choose either result.

description.p: When you burn a metal using a Metal Die, you can expend an additional Metal Die to flare it with duralumin. The metal’s range, potency, or duration (your choice) is doubled. For example, you might double Steel’s shove distance, Tin’s duration, or the temporary hit points granted by Pewter.

You can apply force to even small or non-metallic objects. While burning Iron or Steel, you can Push or Pull non-metallic objects up to 20 pounds within 30 feet and manipulate them with fine precision, such as opening latches, drawing weapons, or moving keys and small items.
While you are burning Steel or Pewter, your speed increases by 20 feet, and you can take the Dash action as a bonus action on each of your turns for up to 1 minute.
Once per long rest, you can burn all metals in a storm of power. As a bonus action, you enter a Mistborn state for 1 minute. For the duration:

ul.li: You can use two metal powers per turn.
You have advantage on all saving throws.
You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

p.em: “I store what I am so I may become what I must.”

description.p: Feruchemists store their own essence within metalminds, drawing upon it later to amplify themselves. They pay a price now to gain incredible power in the moments that matter.
You can store or tap one of the following attributes in a metalmind you carry: Strength, Health, Speed, Perception, Stamina, or Weight.
Store. For each hour you store an attribute, you take a –2 penalty to checks and rolls that rely on that attribute (as decided by the DM). The stored power accumulates in your metalmind.

Tap. As a bonus action, you can Tap one stored attribute, expending a Metal Die. For a number of minutes equal to your Invested level, you gain a +2 bonus on rolls using that attribute (such as Strength checks, Constitution saving throws for Stamina, or Wisdom (Perception) checks for Perception).
You can store or tap two attributes at once. When you do so, each attribute functions as it normally would for Store and Tap, but you must track each separately.

When you expend a Metal Die to Tap an attribute, roll the die twice and choose the higher result to determine any effect that scales with the die’s roll (such as bonus hit points or bonus movement if your DM uses such scaling).

You can begin storing an attribute as a bonus action instead of needing extended downtime. You can maintain this focused storage for up to 10 minutes, suffering the normal penalties while rapidly filling your metalminds.
Once per long rest, you may unleash all your stored attributes at once. As a bonus action, you Tap all attributes you currently have stored for 1 minute. For the duration:

ul.li: You gain a +2 bonus on all rolls.
At the start of each of your turns, you regain 10 hit points.
You have resistance to all damage except psychic.

description.p: Hemalurgists steal fragments of souls, embedding them as spikes. Each spike grants great power — and greater damnation. Their bodies and minds warp under the weight of stolen Investiture, tracked by a Corruption score.

You can forge soul-spikes from the dead. When a creature dies within 10 feet of you, you can spend 1 hour working with a suitable piece of metal to craft a Hemalurgic spike from the creature’s remains.

Each spike grants you one trait from the creature and increases your Corruption by 1. Your maximum number of spikes equals your proficiency bonus. If you ever exceed this limit, you must immediately choose and destroy spikes until you are at or below the maximum.

tr.td: You gain a +2 bonus to Strength or Dexterity (your choice when the spike is created).
You learn one 1st-level spell from the creature’s spell list. You can cast it once per long rest without a spell slot, using Wisdom as your casting ability.
You gain a +1 bonus to AC or resistance to one damage type the creature could resist.
When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points, you regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.
You have advantage on Wisdom or Intelligence checks (choose one when the spike is created).

description.p: Your Corruption score is equal to the number of spikes you currently bear. The DM may call for additional roleplay or drawbacks as your Corruption grows.
You can trade your own life for fuel. As a bonus action, you can take damage equal to your proficiency bonus to regain one expended Metal Die.

You can merge the powers of your spikes. When crafting a spike, you can combine two spike traits into one hybrid spike. This hybrid spike counts as 2 Corruption and uses up two of your spike slots, but grants both chosen benefits.

You ride the edge of sanity without falling. You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, or magically dominated. In addition, you add your current Corruption score to all Charisma (Intimidation) checks.
Once per long rest, you can fully embrace your corruption. As a bonus action, you enter a Godblood state for 1 minute. For the duration:

ul.li: You have resistance to all damage.
You can use any Path of the Invested ability, regardless of which Path you chose.

description.p: When the state ends, you take 4d12 necrotic damage that can’t be reduced in any way, and your Corruption score increases by 1 permanently.
